title: Climate change shifts the North Pacific storm track polewards

Article 
 ADS

en: Climate change shifts the North Pacific storm track polewards. title: Jupiter’s moon Europa may lack key ingredients for life in its subsurface ocean: study

subsurface ocean thought to be hidden under an outer sh… [+4546 chars]

Wissenschaftler fanden heraus, dass der felsige Meeresboden Europas wahrscheinlich zu stark ist, um tektonische oder vulkanische Aktivitäten zu unterstützen, Prozesse, die auf der Erde chemische Energie und lebenswichtige Nährstoffe liefern.
en: Jupiter’s moon Europa may lack key ingredients for life in its subsurface ocean: study. Scientists found that Europa’s rocky seafloor is likely too strong to support tectonic or volcanic activity, processes that on Earth provide chemical energy and nutrients essential for life.

title: Early hominins from Morocco basal to the Homo sapiens lineage
description: New hominin fossils from the Grotte à Hominidés at Thomas Quarry I (ThI-GH) in Casablanca, Morocco, dated to around 773 thousand years ago are similar in age to Homo antecessor, yet are morphologically distinct.
content:
Excavation methods
ThI-GH SU4 and SU5 have been systematically excavated since 1994. A 0.5/1-m-deep sequence of an area of 48m2 was excavated (Fig. 3a and Extended Data Fig. 1b). Excavation was perf… [+20552 chars]

Neue Hominin-Fossilien aus der Grotte à Hominidés im Thomas-Steinbruch I (ThI-GH) in Casablanca, Marokko, die auf etwa 773.000 Jahre datiert werden, ähneln im Alter dem Homo antecessor, sind jedoch morphologisch unterschiedlich.
en: Early hominins from Morocco basal to the Homo sapiens lineage. New hominin fossils from the Grotte à Hominidés at Thomas Quarry I (ThI-GH) in Casablanca, Morocco, dated to around 773 thousand years ago are similar in age to Homo antecessor, yet are morphologically distinct.
la: Early hominins from Morocco basal to the Homo sapiens genus. Novi homininum fossilium a Grotte à Hominidés apud Thomam Quarry I (ThI-GH) in Casablanca, Mauritania, ad mille circiter annos DCCLXXIII data, homini antecessori similes sunt, morphologice tamen distinctae sunt.

title: Pulse heating and slip enhance charging of phase-change thermal batteries
description: A strategy based on the design of a composite coating that enables slip-enhanced close-contact melting inside sealed phase-change thermal batteries to improve charging rates enables high-performance thermal energy storage over a wide range of temperatures.

en: Pulse heating and slip enhance charging of phase-change thermal batteries. A strategy based on the design of a composite coating that enables slip-enhanced close-contact melting inside sealed phase-change thermal batteries to improve charging rates enables high-performance thermal energy storage over a wide range of temperatures.

title: RNA-triggered Cas12a3 cleaves tRNA tails to execute bacterial immunity
description: Cas12a3 nucleases constitute a distinct clade of type V CRISPR–Cas bacterial immune systems that preferentially cleave the 3′ tails of tRNAs after recognition of target RNA to induce growth arrest and block phage dissemination.
content:

de: Durch RNA ausgelöstes Cas12a3 spaltet tRNA-Schwänze, um eine bakterielle Immunität auszulösen. Cas12a3-Nukleasen stellen eine bestimmte Gruppe bakterieller Immunsysteme vom Typ V CRISPR-Cas dar, die nach Erkennung der Ziel-RNA bevorzugt die 3′-Schwänze von tRNAs spalten, um einen Wachstumsstopp herbeizuführen und die Phagenverbreitung zu blockieren.
en: RNA-triggered Cas12a3 cleaves tRNA tails to execute bacterial immunity. Cas12a3 nucleases constitute a distinct clade of type V CRISPR–Cas bacterial immune systems that preferentially cleave the 3′ tails of tRNAs after recognition of target RNA to induce growth arrest and block phage dissemination.
la: RNA Urguet Cas12a3 adhaeret trNA caudae ad immunitatem bacterial exequendam. Cas12a3 nucleases insignem cladem generis V CRISPR-cas systemata bacterial immunes quae potius 3′ caudis trNAs cohaerent, post agnitionem scopum RNA ad incrementum capiendum et obstructum disseminationem inducendam.

title: High microbial diversity in glacial habitats uncoupled from the specialized microbiomes of resident chironomid fauna
description: Ecosystems associated with retreating glaciers are undergoing rapid transformation in the context of a changing climate. Invertebrate fauna, including the Chironomidae insect family (non-biting midges), is part of the active biology that characterizes glacier…
content:
Introduction
Within the different aquatic insects, the object of this research are the non-biting midges (Diptera Chironomidae), which represent the insect family most vastly distributed in cold fre… [+56410 chars]
de: Hohe mikrobielle Vielfalt in Gletscherlebensräumen, entkoppelt von den spezialisierten Mikrobiomen der ansässigen Chironomidenfauna. Ökosysteme, die mit dem Rückgang der Gletscher verbunden sind, unterliegen im Zusammenhang mit dem Klimawandel einem raschen Wandel. Die Fauna der Wirbellosen, einschließlich der Insektenfamilie Chironomidae (nicht beißende Mücken), ist Teil der aktiven Biologie, die Gletscher charakterisiert.
en: High microbial diversity in glacial habitats uncoupled from the specialized microbiomes of resident chironomid fauna. Ecosystems associated with retreating glaciers are undergoing rapid transformation in the context of a changing climate. Invertebrate fauna, including the Chironomidae insect family (non-biting midges), is part of the active biology that characterizes glacier…
la: Alta diversitas microbialis in habitatibus glacialibus inaufficiens e microbiomis specialioribus incolarum chironomid fauna. oecosystemata cum cedentibus molibus coniungitur in contextu climatis mutati celeris transformationem subire. Fauna invertebrata, inter quas familia insecti Chironomidae (medges non-mordens), est pars biologiae activae quae glaciem designat.

en: In Colorado’s devastatingly dry winter, hope abounds for big snows to round out the season: ‘It’s not time for panic’. It will take more than this weekend's arctic blast and snowstorm to make up for Colorado's dearth of snow. "You need February and March to be nonstop snowstorms," the state climatologist says.
